titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Herbert Hoover Oral History Program Interviews, 1966-1973
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Herbert Hoover Oral History Program interviews,
did.abstract: Originals in possession of : Herbert Hoover Presidential Library. Interviews with political leaders, businessmen, military officers, journalists, writers, physicians, secretaries, aides, friends, and associates of Herbert Hoover, relating to their recollections of Hoover in various capacities, including relief work director, president of the United States, and chairman of the Hoover Commissions. Interviews sponsored by the Herbert Hoover Presidential Library and the Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: One folder in Box 10 (Leslie R. Groves interview) closed until five years after the death of David Rockefeller. One folder in Box 7 (Dwight D. Eisenhower interview) closed until 2017.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.
Paul R. Leach interview may not be quoted without permission.
Helen J. D. Sioussat interview may not be quoted without permission.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Herbert Hoover Oral History Program interviews, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

did.unittitle: TRANSCRIPTS, 1966-1972

scopecontent.p: Typewritten and mimeographed transcripts of oral history interviews with persons who knew and were associated with Herbert Hoover. Arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Adams, Charles F. (father was Sec. of Navy in the Hoover Admin.--interviewee had little personal contact with H.H.)
Aiken, George D. (Senator from Vermont; Second Hoover Commission)
Akerson, George E., Jr. (father was a secretary to H.H.; re: H.H.'s relations with the press)
Albright, Horace M. (Director of the National Park Service under H.H.; re: parks and Camp Rapidan)
Albury, Calvin (fishing guide)
Allen, Mrs. Ben S. (husband was Stanford University alumnus, journalist and friend of H.H.--primarily social contact)
Allen, Robert S. (journalist)
Anderson, Jack Z. (Congressman from California and Republican Party activist)
Anderson, William B. (re: H.H. birthplace, West Branch, Iowa)
Andrews, T. Coleman (Second Hoover Commission)
Angell, James B. (carillonneur at Stanford University and engineer--only one contact with H.H.)
Anthony, Edward and Esther (aide to H.H. during the 1928 presidential campaign)

Brooks, Katurah and Phillips P. (maid and messenger)
Brouha, Elizabeth Shaler (father worked with C.R.B.)

Camp, Loretta L. Francis (secretary to H.H.)

Clark, Birge M. (architect; re: Hoover home on the Stanford University campus)

Coberly, William B., Jr. (Stanford University alumnus and brother-in-law of Allan Hoover)

Curtice, Arthur A. (oil and mining associate of H.H., Jr.)
Davie, Eugenie M. (Republican Party activity--little personal contact)
Davis, Joseph S. (Director, Stanford University Food Research Institute; involved with post-World War I food relief)

Eisenhower, President Dwight D. (re: the Second Hoover Commission, appointed by President Eisenhower, and the Bonus Army--General Eisenhower was an aide to General MacArthur, Chief of Staff during the Hoover Administration) RESTRICTED SECTION(2 pages):closed until 2017

Thomas, Lowell (casual friend)

Tierney, Nicholas A. (physician in Florida)

Wellington, Laurence C. (C.R.B. and A.R.A.)

Young, Clarence M. (Asst. Sec. for Aeronautics in Commerce Department under H.H.)
PHONOTAPES, 1965-1968.

scopecontent.p: Sound recordings of interviews and a speech by President Lyndon Johnson. Arranged alphabetically by name of speaker.

did.unittitle: Clark (Birge) interview

scopecontent.p: Birge, an architect, talks about the Herbert Hoover family and Stanford University. Use copy reference number: xx028_a_0008069

did.unittitle: Clark (Esther) interview

scopecontent.p: Dr. Rita R. Campbell interviews Dr. Clark concerning Herbert Hoover at Stanford University, and the Hoover home. Use copy reference number: xx028_a_0008068

did.unittitle: Johnson (President Lyndon B.) remarks at the signing ceremony for the Herbert Hoover Historical Site 1965 August 12

scopecontent.p: Johnson speaks in the Rose Garden on the occasion of his signing into law the bill for the Herbert Hoover Historical Site, West Branch. Johnson gives his thoughts about Hoover as a man, as a president, and as a presidential adviser. Use copy reference number: xx028_a_0008067
